summary: Dan L. Hardway is identified as an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). His name appears in multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from October 1977 to November 1978. These documents list his position and salary during that period. The documents suggest that Dan L. Hardway was a staff member of the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Dan L. Hardway's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with investigating the JFK assassination. As a staff member, he was involved in the investigation, though the specific nature and extent of his contributions are not detailed in these documents.
